entry.title: Gracefully handle invalid validation data from version skew
entry.content:
It is possible for there to be version skew between chrome

and the elevation_service. This is normally fine as the data

is designed to be compatible with any version and stateless,

and data is identified with a enum.



However, path validation was recently changed to use different

format but the enum values were not updated.



This could cause e.g. newer clients with older elevation_service

to Encrypt data with an older set of validation data, then

eventually subsequently attempt to decrypt this data with a

newer version.



It's important that Encrypt calls do not succeed in this case of

version mismatch, so PATH_VALIDATION is bumped to type 2 validation,

meaning that newer clients will fail to Encrypt as older

elevation_service will always reject protection level > 1.



In these case, the Encrypt call will fail, and the client will

try again later, once the version skew has been resolved.



All cases of Decrypt are now correctly handled:



- Old data (that started with fixed string PATH) fails to be

within the valid rage as 'P' is > PROTECTION_MAX. This data

should only be presented by clients that had a version

mismatch previously.

- Recent data (that is of type 1, new format) that was

encrypted since path validation data was changed, is still

valid and can be treated exactly the same as type 2 data.

- Newest data is of type 2 already and just works.



BUG=331840486



Change-Id: I8298a35ce2b43e01c967ab0c2de22b050cc34edb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5408266

Commit-Queue: Will Harris

Reviewed-by: S Ganesh

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1280865}

entry.title: Remove HttpStream::GetSSLCertRequestInfo().
entry.content:
There are a lot of null implementations of this, with only

HttpStreamParser and those classes that wrap it actually implementing

it. HttpNetworkTransaction::DoReadHeadersComplete(), the only caller of

the method, writes the information to HttpResponseInfo's

`cert_request_info` field. HttpStreamParser already has a pointer to

that field, though, and is responsible for reading the headers, so knows

when it needs to be filled. So switch HttpStreamParser to populating

the field directly, when needed.



The main motivation for this change is not code simplification, but

because this is the only HttpStreamParser call that accesses its

`response_` field after reading headers. As HttpResponseBodyDrainer

expects HttpStreamParser to be able to outlive the `response_` field

after reading headers has successfully completed, we need to null out

`response_` after reading headers. Thus, this method needs to be fixed

not to access `response_` after reading headers, so we can null it out

when reading headers are complete.



It's just a happy coincidence that this call isn't actually needed at

all.



Bug: 40212619

Change-Id: I80891558d2723c8b575514c2eee4add75d84313b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5405428

Commit-Queue: mmenke

Reviewed-by: David Benjamin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1280853}

entry.title: [Protected Audience] Update DoGetInterestGroupsForOwner to load data in one pass
entry.content:
Currently, we query the interest group names first, and then for each

name, we query for matching entries. We switch to load all data at once,

and do the sorting in C++. Offline testings have shown that this could

reduce the load time by 30% on a large database.



Also, fix/improve a test. We modify the expiry time to make the

ordering deterministic.



Bug: 331902978

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Announce accessible alerts through the toolbar button
entry.content:
This CL completes the basic functionality of restoring accessible alerts

to the download bubble. It makes the DownloadDisplayController take

alerts from the DownloadBubbleUpdateService, which takes them in turn

from the DownloadBubbleAccessibleAlertsMap. The alert strings are then

announced through the DownloadToolbarButtonView.



This removes the old accessible alert functionality from

DownloadBubbleRowView, to avoid redundancy. These old alerts were sort

of broken because they require the bubble to be open so that the row

view is visible and can announce text. Most users do not have the

download bubble open all the time.



One remaining bug is that automatic deep scans produce 2 alerts when

they should produce just 1. This is due to 2 calls to update observers.

This will be fixed separately by reducing that transition to just 1

update call. For now, double alerts are produced for deep scans; this

is not a major issue as these are relatively rare.



Bug: 40926583

entry.title: [anchor] Sort candidate list before handing off to OOFLayoutPart.
entry.content:
The order of the candidates now is important, when it wasn't

previously. The order is only important when there is a child that

has an anchor within it, so to mitigate the performance, only sort

when that is true.



The order can get inconsistent for a variety of reasons, the testcase

is when we insert them in the incorrect order during simplified layout

(as we don't keep the OOFs in the same list as the child fragments).



Fixed: 330756838

entry.title: Extending MediaClient API to allow setting a media allocator.
entry.content:
This allows an embedder to add a custom allocator which provides one method, taking a span and which returns a DecoderBuffer::ExternalMemory, which is compatible with creating StreamParserBuffers.



This will enable the use of external memory such as Android's MediaCodec.LinearBlock

entry.title: Fenced frames: disableUntrustedNetwork() for WebSockets.
entry.content:
This CL prevents WebSockets from being created in frames with network

access revoked, and closes existing WebSockets if a frame loses network

access.



Preventing new WebSockets from being created works similarly to the

network access check in CorsURLLoaderFactory::CreateLoaderAndStart().

Closing existing WebSockets works similarly to

URLLoader::CancelRequestIfNonceMatchesAndUrlNotExempted().



Change-Id: Ia2a6b2a3c29423729c386f405637673bbe11fe80

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5397251

entry.title: [Cast Convergence] Set up new Cast builders.
entry.content:
This is part 3/3 of a multi-part change to update Cast Linux builders

in Chromium. The is_castos flag is no longer supported in upstream

Chrome.



The following builders will be turned down:

- Cast Linux ARM64 / linux-arm64-castos

- Cast Linux Debug / linux-x64-castos-dbg

- Cast Linux / linux-x64-castos



They will be replaced with roughly the following:



- linux-arm64-cast-rel (for validating builds pushed to devices)

- linux-x64-cast-dbg (for validating that desktop builds work)



This CL re-uses the test suites from the previous builders. The unused suites will be deleted in a followup CL.



Android and Fuchsia cast builders remain unaffected.



Fixed: b:41489655,b:244777999

Change-Id: I29bcfb41149316fa3964c4de3e93bb19d89ae826

entry.title: [a11y]: provide default move constructor and assignment operator for AXTreeUpdate and AXEvent
entry.content:
According to spec, compilers won't include a move constructor or move

assignment operator if certain conditions do not hold.



Two of them are if the class has a copy constructor, or a

destructor. Both structs have them, so won't have a move constructor

generated automatically.



Copy elision is another factor to consider. It may make some uses of

these structs more efficient than copying.



In subsequent changes, an attempt will be made to delete the copy

constructor/assignment operator for each struct and auditing all

compiler errors for potential costly copies.



https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/move_assignment

https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/move_constructor



Bug: 332302437

Change-Id: I5f3a8fd7bd4bfe145ee8cdc72e987cb251e5dc63

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5403459

entry.title: PDF OCR: Remove trailing whitespace in tree dump for tests
entry.content:
OCR is subject to detect whitespace after a sentence and put it in its

results, which is quite difficult for us to anticipate when. We recently

observed this behavior in PDFOCRIntegrationTest after upreving the

screen-ai library to version 123.6 [1]. To mitigate this unexpected

behavior, remove trailing whitespace in OCR results inserted into a

static text node for tests using `DumpPdfAccessibilityTree`.



[1] https://crrev.com/c/5388533



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: [editing] createLink command dispatches an input event with data and inputType which is set as `insertLink`
entry.content:
According to the spec:

https://w3c.github.io/input-events/#interface-InputEvent-Attributes

When inserting a link, `inputType` value should be set to `insertLink`.

The `InputType` enumeration type, which is defined in

`third_party/blink/renderer/core/events/input_event.h`

is not in compliance with the spec and lacks the `inesetLink` value.



The `createLink` test case, which is defined in

`external/wpt/input-events/input-events-exec-command.html`,

will be failed due to the absence of `data` and `inputType`

attributes in the event. These test case only failed in Chrome,

while Firefox and Safari were ok.

`createLink` should dispatch an input event with `data`

and `inputType` which is set as `insertLink`.



Bug: 331836632

Change-Id: I7e789bac0a32713bbf1f0b27832d93c9ca1833d0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5392761

entry.title: [//gpu] Set default value for Mac texture target in SharedImageCaps
entry.content:
I had hoped to initialize this state to 0 and enforce that clients would

appropriately initialize it when creating SICaps. However, unittests

broadly create and use SharedImageCapabilities instances without

initializing this field. The lack of initialization causes

ClientSharedImage creation to crash in the context of these tests when

it uses this state in setting its texture target.



These tests currently work because legacy global variable that stores

the Mac texture target is initialized to GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB, which

is a valid value for ClientSharedImage to use. In the interest of moving

along the production change, this CL changes SharedImageCapabilities to

also initialize this state to GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB. In the fullness

of time, I still want to fix all of the unittest creation sites and

make the change described above. However, there is no reason for that to

block changing the production code away from using the legacy global

variable.



Bug: 41494843

Change-Id: I2e63696d9640413fa45fb0ed7250abfc3c34b024

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5401809

entry.title: Tailor Widget offerings for specific screen sizes.
entry.content:
Android team recently introduced a change that now crops widget

previews to their minimum reported size.



Bumping the minimum widget size so that the preview is not cropped

would result with widgets not being offered on small screen devices.



This change introduces additional styles and measurements ensuring

that we

- continue to offer widgets on small screen devices (down to 240dp),

- align visuals of the widget previews on these small screens so these

resemble the actual result more closely.



Change-Id: I85a290090f2853bd6eb09d9e8ff45a309e960eb8

entry.title: Prevent AttributionOsLeveManagerAndroid from being used when disabled
entry.content:
Without this, when the registration was disabled, the callback was added

to the pending list but never invoked or removed.



In practice, this code was unreachable due to a check in the

AttributionManagerImpl, but that was not robust and required readers of

the code to have greater context.

entry.title: Don't exclude non string literals from the rewrite
entry.content:
Rewriting const char pointers was skipped for performance as they are

likely to point to string literals. This exclusion mechanism also

wrongly excluded some non-string-literals like `const uint8_t*` and

`const int8*`.



This cl ensures only string literals are excluded.

This behaviour is enabled by default for the raw_ptr rewriter.

A command line option is to enforce the new behaviour in the raw_ptr

enforcement plugin.



Change-Id: I59f85a11a42d57228b3a2b76b8c7a39496a4104b

entry.title: [//gpu] Add unittest of ClientSI creation from SharedImageInterface
entry.content:
This CL adds a unittest of ClientSharedImage creation from

SharedImageInterface. To do so, we add a TestSharedImageInterface

implementation in client_shared_image_unittest.cc (the only existing one

is in //components/viz and is much heavierweight). We stub everything

out except for the one function needed to create a ClientSI in the

initial unittest. We will fill it out as the tests expand over time.



Note: While it might seem odd to create ClientSharedImage from

SharedImageInterface in the ClientSharedImage unittest, this is the

only and intended supported model of creating ClientSharedImages beyond

ImportUnowned() (which is already tested). Unless going through

ImportUnowned(), a ClientSharedImage instance *must* be supplied a

SharedImageInterfaceHolder, and that can *only* be given by a subclass

of SharedImageInterface.



Bug: 40286368

Change-Id: Ia47ed9250c7be46a1508e8310b32d53c37245857

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5407653

Reviewed-by: Quyen Le

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1280691}

entry.title: [//gpu] Initialize SICaps' MacOS-specific texture target to 0
entry.content:
As with the other fields, the creator of a SharedImageCapabilities

instance must ensure that this field is set to an appropriate value.

This CL initializes it to 0 to ensure that it has a reliable sentinel

value for easing debugging of cases where the creator misses setting

the value.



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: arc: volume_mounter: Set device_label of disks if it's empty
entry.content:
Android's ExternalStorageProvider uses device_label of a disk as the

title of DocumentsProvider root that corresponds to the volume shared

from ChromeOS. Since title of DocumentsProvider root is a required field

and is used as the display name in Android DocumentsUI, it should not be

left empty. Also, as we saw in arc.RemovableMedia with CL:5404608

applied, having a DocumentsProvider root with empty title could break

FileSystemConnection due to missing a required field in the result of

GetRoots() mojo call. Hence this CL ensures that device_label of a disk

propagated to ARC is always non-empty by setting it to the base name of

the disk's mount path if it's not already set. Note that the same

fallback logic is used in Files app and Settings app (b/255485048).



BUG=b:328292078

TEST=`tast run arc.RemovableMedia.vm` with CL:5404608



Change-Id: Iabac4f224c1078cf40de8a4e00c8e3f70424c909

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5404315

Commit-Queue: Momoko Hattori

Reviewed-by: Youkichi Hosoi

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1280689}

entry.title: Set num_bytes manually if the queried size was zero
entry.content:
This CL adds a speculative fix and more crash keys to address the crash

by receiving |MOJO_RESULT_INVALID_ARGUMENT| from DataPipe::ReadData().



From the crash, we noticed |num_bytes| via |MOJO_READ_DATA_FLAG_QUERY|

is zero, and that makes |MOJO_RESULT_INVALID_ARGUMENT| in second

ReadData() call, which is the actual read operation.



We can expect this method is called only when the pipe is readable, or

closed because this is called through SimpleWatcher::ArmOrNotify() only.



We believe the second ReadData() successfully returns

|MOJO_RESULT_FAILED_PRECONDITION| or |MOJO_RESULT_SHOULD_WAIT|, which

are correctly handled by the callee side, if we pass |num_bytes| having

positive value. Adding more crash keys to ensure that.



Bug: 1472634

Change-Id: Ia0ea353543c896129be8748af4e93e0c9a68413b

entry.title: Respect keyboard layout in KeyboardModifierEventRewriter
entry.content:
This is the fix of some edge cases that the original

KeyboardModifierEventRewriter had.

- This CL simplifies the remapping logic just to depend on DomCode.

- DomKey and KeyboardCode are looked up based on

- Remapped DomCode

- Respecting current KeyboardLayout

- Modifiers being tracked.



As a result, there're several edge case behavior changes need to be

introduced.

- On Neo2 keyboard, level5-shift-mod3 key (~Caps) sets EF_MOD3_DOWN

in EventRewriterAsh, but the flag will be dropped, respecting the

original mapping.

- On international US layout, ALTGR wasn't remapped on producing

alphabets with some decorations. With this fix, ALTGR is now

remapped properly. E.g., with swapping ALT/CTRL, physical right-control

key + A will produce a with accent.

- On Korean layout, following users' expectation, we stick ALTGR in

right-alt key even if ALT/CTRL swapping is set in user configuration.

(As a side-effect, with swapping alt/ctrl, there's no ways to send

right-control currently and both right-alt and right-control are

assigned to ALTGR, but this is WAI now).



BUG=b/236550969, b/40265877

TEST=Tryjob. inputs.PhysicalKeyboardAltgr Tast test.

Manually tested following with alt/control swap.

- alphabet + accent mark with US international layout.

- Level5-shift-mod3 key event on Neo2 layout.

- HANGUL_MODE key case with Korean layout.

- Alt-GR latch works with Latovian layout.



Change-Id: Iaf71b235b53d2c2a582d0421698ace0f7385a2a0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5396096

entry.title: [Extensions] Confirm that worker stop notification is on UI thread.
entry.content:
As seen in the bug, //extensions doesn't always get the worker thread

termination (WorkerThread::PrepareForShutdownOnWorkerThread())

notification (ServiceWorkerHost::DidStopServiceWorkerContext()) before ServiceWorkerVersion::OnTimeoutTimer() is called for the shutdown

timing out. OnTimeoutTimer() causes ~ServiceWorkerHost for the previous

worker so even if the notification is eventually sent it won't be seen.



This causes //extensions to not clean up a previous record

of the worker in WorkerIdSet There are also other situations where

synchronous notification of worker stop would help.



//extensions would like to make this notification synchronous to help

with this.



From my own local testing, it seems that all the //content browser

process logic for the running status notifications are on the same

thread as the //extensions logic. This was likely due to the

ServiceWorkerOnUI project. I'd like to DCHECK this to confirm before

assuming.



Bug: 40936639
